Firstly, Heath Ledger's work on The Dark Knight was as an actor playing the role of the Joker. Acting is a creative and often physically demanding job, but it does not involve physical danger or risk comparable to jobs in professions like construction or firefighting. Therefore, it is unlikely that Ledger's work as an actor caused his death directly.

Secondly, Heath Ledger died of an accidental overdose of prescription drugs. This was the result of an individual choice he made and was not caused by his work on The Dark Knight or any other film.

Finally, it is worth noting that the intense emotional and physical demands of his role in The Dark Knight may have contributed to Ledger's mental state and made him more susceptible to addiction and substance abuse, which ultimately led to his untimely death. However, this does not mean that the film itself caused his death.

Overall, while it is possible to draw connections between Ledger's work on The Dark Knight and his eventual death, there is no conclusive evidence to suggest that one caused the other. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no.

According to the official report released by the New York City medical examiner's office, Ledger died due to an accidental overdose of prescription drugs that included painkillers, sleeping pills, and anti-anxiety medication. Therefore, the answer to the question is (B) no – the death of Heath Ledger was not caused by his work on The Dark Knight.
